conversations.content: Dreams A'wonder: Part One
My cute, marvelous dress had a nice fluffy frill and big ribbons. Whenever I picked up the skirts to curtsy, I felt like the princess I wanted to be!
Yet, I was but a farmer's daughter, and my parents spared no chance to lecture me. ＂You can barely move in those fool clothes, girl!＂ they said. ＂How are you to work the fields?＂
All I wanted to do was dress like a princess, but they didn't understand. So one especially bad day, I took off running—tears streaming down my cheeks—and ended up lost.
By the time I noticed what I'd done, I was lost in a deep, dark forest. My body quaked with nerves, and I saw danger in every hesitant, trembling step that I made.
Just then, I chanced upon a tiny little workshop with two dragons inside! ＂Welcome to our cute'n dreamy shop!＂ said one. ＂Cre-cre!＂ (Have yous a seat!) said the other.
The pair was a curious duo of smiths, and their shop was filled to the brim with sparkling, fluffy weapons. It was like I had wandered into some kind of wonderful dream!
＂I've never seen anything like this,＂ I said as I gazed around the shop. ＂Right?!＂ replied one. ＂Gaibhne makes all the weapons FUUULL of the stuff Gaibhne likes!＂
The dragon's words brought to mind my earlier argument with my parents, and a heavy gloom settled over me. ＂Do people ask you to make such strange weapons?＂ I inquired.
＂Hee hee! No, I don't worry about a little thing like that—I just make whatever I feel like that day!＂
＂How does that not worry you?＂ ＂If my heart isn't light and fluffy, I get the sadsies! And Gaibhne with sadsies isn't Gaibhne at all!＂
Despite the shop being full of radiant things, Gaibhne's face was the most remarkable of all. I felt as if the light she gave off made all the weapons more wonderful as a result.
That's how I wanted to be! Radiant! I wanted to follow my heart and enjoy the all things I loved!  And so, a few years passed...
Dreams A'wonder: Part Two
Farmer or not, I wanted to wear cute clothes! After a fight with my parents a few years back, I got lost in some woods and met Gaibhne—a dragon who gave me courage.
Now I'm a tailor, and EVERYONE can share what I love! My dresses are cute and marvelous, with lots of big ribbons and extra-fluffy frills. Oh, but that's not all...
The skirts and sleeves are hemmed short to allow for free and easy movement. That's right—it's workwear styled like a dress!
People far and wide have come to purchase my clothes, which have become quite the rage. And it's all thanks to that dragon in the woods!
Speaking of Gaibhne, I met another unexpected person through my work—a painter with a unique style. After striking up a conversation, the artist said this:
＂I used to hide the fact that I liked these kinds of paintings. But one day, a dragon in the woods gave me the courage to pursue my dream and create the art that speaks to me.＂
What a shock to learn this artist had also been influenced by Gaibhne! I began looking for others, and soon found singers, dancers, authors and more who owed it all to the dragon.
So many people learned courage from Gaibhne, which allowed them to express their own unique vision. Once I knew this, I got them all together to go thank the dragon.
It's been a long time since I entered the forest, but I remember the way. Soon I come across the workshop, but there's something different about it...
The tiny shop is now a huge castle— and it's SO CUTE! The grounds are fluffy clouds! Soap bubbles waft to and fro! And hanging above it all is a gigantic rainbow!
＂A'welcome back to our Cute'n Dreamy Kingdom!＂ said Gaibhne. ＂It's so great to see how well you've done,＂ I replied. ＂We're all so very proud of you!＂
But now, it's time to continue on. All of us will share our passions with more and more people, and soon we'll have an entire world filled with the sparkle of dreams!
